definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

to cover/to encase/cover/sheath/to overlap/to interleave/to model after/to copy/formula/harness/loop of rope/(fig.) to fish for/to obtain slyly/classifier for sets, collections/bend (of a river or mountain range, in place names)/tau (Greek letter Ττ)

sentences.english: The Constant Gardener is talky and intelligent, and never takes the cheap way out.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影有很多对白，充满智慧，而且从不俗气老套。

sentences.english: Just be yourself, and do what you like.
sentences.chinese: 虽然桥段很老套，不过还是很适合阖家欢乐的。

sentences.english: You're behind the times, Arthur, you're old-fashioned.
sentences.chinese: 你落伍了，亚瑟，你太老套。

sentences.english: Well, this is hugely stereotypical, hugely appropriative.
sentences.chinese: 这是个非常明显的他固有的老套说辞。

sentences.english: They were sick of Allan's cut-and-dried answers.
sentences.chinese: 他们对艾伦老套的答复感到厌烦。

sentences.english: What once looked unwearable now seems ordinary, and what once seemed banal now looks right.
sentences.chinese: 曾经似乎老套的衣服，现在看来很合适。

sentences.english: And I am not going to propose any universal answer in this article.
sentences.chinese: 在这篇文章里我并不打算用那些老套的回答。

sentences.english: I don't like the conventional happy ending of this movie.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢这部电影老套的大团圆结局。

sentences.english: Its art of printing had withered into the production of stereotyped editions of Confucius.
sentences.chinese: 它的印刷术沦落为老套的孔子的作品。

sentences.english: Cheap, Hardly Effcient, Virtually Runs On Luck Every Time.
sentences.chinese: 便宜，老套，每次发动他只能靠运气。

definition: silly talk or "mo lei tau" (Cantonese), genre of humor emerging from Hong Kong late in the 20th century
to stir up emotion/to arouse sympathy/moving
to conform to no conventional pattern/unconventional/offbeat
to act cleverly to get what one desires/to get the best at least expense
